[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Weak Hash Function] Does the HashValue type for first_key/last_key use a cryptographically secure hash function, or could birthday attacks create collisions allowing attacker to substitute chunk data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Root Hash Collision] If root_hash uses a weak hash algorithm, could an attacker find a collision to construct alternative state trees that hash to the same root, bypassing integrity checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Proof Malleability] Can the SparseMerkleRangeProof be modified to have multiple valid serializations, allowing an attacker to present different proofs for the same chunk that all verify correctly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Signature Stripping] Can an attacker remove signatures from LedgerInfoWithSignatures in the proof FileHandle while keeping the structure valid, bypassing quorum requirements? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Cross-Epoch Mixing] Can chunks from different epochs be mixed in a single StateSnapshotBackup manifest, causing state from incompatible validator sets to be merged during restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Key Range Mismatch] If first_key > last_key in hash ordering, can this cause reverse iteration during Merkle tree construction, corrupting the tree structure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Incomplete Coverage] Can a manifest with chunks that don't cover the full state key space (missing ranges between first_key and last_key across all chunks) be accepted, causing partial state restoration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Proof-Data Mismatch] If the blobs data doesn't match the key range specified by first_key/last_key, but the proof verifies against a different range, can mismatched state be restored? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Path Traversal] Can malicious FileHandle values in blobs or proof fields contain path traversal sequences (../) to access files outside the backup storage directory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Symlink Attack] Can FileHandle paths point to symlinks that redirect to arbitrary filesystem locations, allowing attackers to read sensitive validator data or overwrite system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Shared FileHandle] Can multiple chunks reference the same FileHandle for blobs, causing the same data to be deserialized and restored multiple times with different index ranges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [FileHandle Exhaustion] Can a manifest with thousands of unique FileHandle paths exhaust file descriptor limits during parallel chunk restoration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Zero-Length Range] Can first_idx == last_idx create a single-element chunk, and if validation assumes multi-element chunks, could this bypass proof verification requirements? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Index Discontinuity] If chunk N's last_idx + 1 != chunk N+1's first_idx, can the gap cause account indices to be renumbered incorrectly during restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Total Count Mismatch] If the sum of all chunk ranges (last_idx - first_idx + 1) doesn't match the expected total account count, can this indicate missing or duplicate data that goes undetected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Negative Range] Although usize is unsigned, can deserialization from JSON accept negative numbers that wrap around to large positive values for first_idx/last_idx? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Race Condition] If multiple threads deserialize and modify the same StateSnapshotBackup manifest concurrently, can chunks Vec corruption occur due to missing synchronization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [TOCTOU] Can FileHandle paths be modified between validation and actual file access (time-of-check-time-of-use), allowing attackers to swap backup files mid-restoration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Proof Format] Can a malformed SparseMerkleRangeProof that fails BCS deserialization cause proof verification to be skipped with a default success response? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Proof Reuse] Can the same proof FileHandle be reused across multiple StateSnapshotBackup manifests for different versions, allowing old signatures to validate new state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [Partial Proof] Can an attacker provide a valid SparseMerkleRangeProof that only covers a subset of the keys in the blobs data, leaving some accounts unverified? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Signature Threshold] If LedgerInfoWithSignatures contains exactly 2f+1 signatures (minimum quorum), can an attacker with f+1 compromised keys create valid-looking manifests? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Chunk Vector DoS] Can a manifest claiming billions of chunks in the chunks Vec cause allocator failure or OOM killer activation before processing begins? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotChunk] [String Allocation] Can extremely long FileHandle paths (megabytes) in blobs or proof fields cause excessive memory allocation during deserialization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/backup_types/state_snapshot/manifest.rs] [Struct: StateSnapshotBackup] [Version Zero] Can version = 0 be used to restore genesis state, potentially replacing all current state with empty initial state? (Critical)
